ctx: intros P R HR a b Ha Hb.
exceptions.exn: Expects a disjunctive pattern with 2 branches.

chat.content:
Help me to prove a theorem in Coq, based on provided proof states including hypotheses and goals. Give a complete proof in only one single code block without explanations, extra definitions. Give a complete proof in one response, only give the proof body, without repeating the definition and "Proof.". Avoid existing names when using intros. Write the commands separately, without ";" and "[cmd|cmd]". Use bullets for structure, NEVER use "{" and "}". When -, + and * are used out, proceed to double versions like --, ++, etc. For example, given proof state:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m
============================
m + S n = S n + m
The hypotheses n, m: nat and IHn: m + n = n + m are given first, then the goal, m + S n = S n + m, separated by =. Expect a response like: 
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.``` 
You do not intros any terms because all terms have already been introduced.

When I give:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m
============================
n, m: nat
your answer should be like:
```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```
Definitions and lemmas related to the proof will be provided, use them accordingly.


Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Set
A1: A
A0: A
eqA: A -> A -> Prop
plusA: A -> A -> A
invA: A -> A
multA: A -> A -> A
minusA: A -> A -> A
divA: A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A
cs: CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA
eqA_dec: forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b}
n: nat
ltM: mon n -> mon n -> Prop
ltM_dec: forall a b : mon n, {ltM a b} + {ltM b a} + {a = b}
os: OrderStructure (mon n) (zero_mon n) ltM (mult_mon n)
FPset: list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> Set
Co: {x : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) & FPset x} -> {x : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) & FPset x} -> Prop

Goal:
forall P R : list (poly A0 eqA ltM), R = strip (fun R0 : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) => OBuch (fst (P, genOCPf P)) (snd (P, genOCPf P)) R0) (pbuchf (P, genOCPf P)) -> forall a b : poly A0 eqA ltM, In a R -> In b R -> reds a b R

Premises:
fst : ?A * ?B -> ?A where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->
snd : ?A * ?B -> ?B where ?A : [A : Set A0 : A A1 : A eqA : A -> A -> Prop plusA : A -> A -> A invA : A -> A minusA : A -> A -> A multA : A -> A -> A divA : A -> forall b : A, ~ eqA b A0 -> A cs : CoefStructure A A0 A1 eqA plusA invA minusA multA divA eqA_dec : forall a b : A, {eqA a b} + {~ eqA a b} n : nat ltM : mon n -> mon n ->
poly : forall A : Set, A -> (A -> A -> Prop) -> forall n : nat, (mon n -> mon n -> Prop) -> Set
genOCPf = fun H' : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) => list_rec (fun _ : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) => list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) nil (fun (a : poly A0 eqA ltM) (l rec : list (poly A0 eqA ltM)) => genPcPf a l rec) H' : list (poly A0 eqA ltM) -> list (poly A0 eqA ltM) Arguments genOCPf _%list_scope

```coq
intros P R HR a b Ha Hb.
rewrite HR in *.
apply pbuchf_Stable in HR.
destruct HR as [HR1 HR2].
destruct HR1 as [R0 HR0].
apply HR0 in Ha as [c1 Hc1].
apply HR0 in Hb as [c2 Hc2].
apply reds1.
apply HR2 with c1 c2.
+ assumption.
+ assumption.
Qed.
```

original: intros P R HR a b Ha Hb. rewrite HR in *. apply pbuchf_Stable in HR. destruct HR as [HR1 HR2]. destruct HR1 as [R0 HR0]. apply HR0 in Ha as [c1 Hc1]. apply HR0 in Hb as [c2 Hc2]. apply reds1. apply HR2 with c1 c2. + auto. + auto.
